adr_address: 11 Rue Simon le Franc, 75004 Paris, France

editorial_summary.overview: Cozy rooms in an airy hotel offering breakfast in a vaulted cellar, plus a garden & free Wi-Fi.

formatted_address: 11 Rue Simon le Franc, 75004 Paris, France
name: Hôtel Beaubourg

reviews.text:
This is an ideal hotel in a good location next to Pompidou Centre - good value at EU130 per night (i stayed 3 nights) - they take just the first night's stay 3 days before you arrive and you pay the balance on checkout.

The rooms are quite small but I was fine with that - I had a top floor room overlooking the internal courtyard so I could leave my windows wide open and have no noise, but it was a very quiet street so my guess is that all rooms are quiet.

They offer a breakfast in the basement for about 10 euros but I found a nice similarly priced pavement cafe called la fronde at the end of the street which did an excellent breakfast for the same price so went there as i like eating outside in august if possible.

The staff were very friendly and check in and check out was very quick.  There is a small lift but I actually quite liked using the stairs.

The bed was very comfortable and the shower was good as well.  I like the way there was a metro a few yards from the hotel and it was only 5 minutes walk from the main chatalet station which has the RER B line that connects to both the airport and the eurostar

Small Hotel in a wonderful location. Pleasant staff. The only issue I could see for the room we were in would be the bathroom. If you are over 178cm (5'10) or have limited mobility, the tub shower with low ceiling might be an issue.

Bad experience! Not worth the money.
So the rooms are quite small and bathroom is even smaller, you can’t move your hands in shower. They have such a small elevator/lift from old age which can hardly fit a person together with the luggage.
Now coming to hospitality, I know Europe in general lacks hospitality but here you won’t even get a glass of water while you checkin at reception- on asking for some water I was told you will find that in mini bar on payment or go out and buy from supermarket, can You imagine a guest came after a long journey and you dont have even water to offer? In all the countries I travelled in Europe, such behaviour I only see here. Also while I checked in my room, it was hot as flame and AC was not working- on asking reception lady said do this do that and I kept struggling- and after few minutes she called that it was switched off from reception and now she has switched it on and mind it they will switch it off any time they want and you will keep struggling!

Response to their reply: Window was open when you came?? Did you even read what I mentioned?? Ask your reception lady what happened the day I arrived, dont just respond for the sake of responding.
Moreover your lack of accepting that service was not upto the mark, is the reason hotels like yours never improves! What hospitality are you talking about???? Not even offering water to guests who come to your hotel durimg checkin- is a part of your hospitality or not even greeting them when they arruve is a part??? Not having even a handwash ir soap at wash basin to wash hands??? A single soap bottle in shower area was there- guest should use that bottle at basin and then bathing??? Worst experience & even worst service!

Extremely Disappointed – Beware of Early Morning Construction Noise

I rarely leave negative reviews, but I feel compelled to warn future guests. I booked this hotel expecting a restful stay—what I got was 8 AM construction noise every morning, starting sharp with drilling and banging that made it impossible to sleep or relax.

What’s worse: the hotel staff were completely unhelpful and dismissive when I brought it up. I was told there was “nothing they could do,” and there was zero acknowledgment, apology, or offer of accommodation. They were unfriendly and made me feel like I was the problem for bringing it up.

At no point during booking was I made aware of the ongoing construction—this kind of disruption should absolutely be disclosed in advance. It’s incredibly disappointing and feels deceptive.

If you’re looking for a peaceful stay, look elsewhere. I wouldn’t have booked had I known, and I hope this review helps others avoid the same experience.
Wonderful hotel! The room is beautiful, very clean and spacious, the a/c works great, the staff is very attentive and nice, and the location is very central and bustle, yet quiet.
